result.execSummary:
The defendant Trent M. Hish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber/work release, if available (except first 48 hours).  EMP approved, subject to jail rules and if available.  Provide DNA sample.  Jail to commence Forthwith.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
3:13 PM Defendant Trent M. Hish in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Trent M. Hish.  Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin. No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Counts 2 - 4 : Dismissed but read in 

Count 1: 

$2,122.00 fine/costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
$100.00 blood draw cost, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
150 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber/work release (except first 48 hours), if available, consecutive.  Commence FORTHWITH
EMP approved, subject to jail rules and if available
No jail credit
Provide DNA Sample 
30 months Driver License revocation
AODA **(Set up with Clerk of Court's office before leaving the courthouse)**
Ignition Interlock - Immediately and for 30 months Upon Licensure

Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on November 23, 2022 at 08:00 am.

1:15 PM Defendant Trent M. Hish in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Trent M. Hish.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.

4:13 PM Defendant Trent M. Hish in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Trent M. Hish.  Attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court finds waiver to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:47 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trent M. Hish not in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Trent M. Hish.  Atty Masana states they had a hearing yesterday and DE is in inpatient treatment in Waukesha.  Requests these cases track w/other pending matters.  Court resets to 8/31/22 at 4pm in Br 3.
Return date scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Return date on August 31, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Absolute Sobriety; No presence upon bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Not operate m/v w/o being equipped with IID

Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on May 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:53 PM Defendant Trent M. Hish in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Hayes.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trent M. Hish appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney. DE qualifies for PD representation, atty. Masana will be appointed.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE  bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute Sobriety at all times.   No presence upon bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Not operate m/v w/o being equipped with IID.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
